meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or derived from vinyl.
meanings.sent1: The vinylic flooring in the kitchen was easy to clean.
meanings.sent2: She admired the vinylic records in her collection.
meanings.sent3: The vinylic curtains danced in the breeze like happy ghosts.
meanings.sent4: His vinylic voice echoed through the empty hallways.
meanings.sent5: The vinylic smell of the new car lingered in the air.

meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the vinylic compound under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The vinylic molecule showed interesting properties in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The vinylic structure of the molecule looked like a tiny house.
meanings.sent4: Her vinylic bracelet sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The vinylic taste of the medicine was unpleasant but effective.

meanings.sent1: The artist created a vinylic painting that looked like a record.
meanings.sent2: The vinylic texture of the fabric reminded her of old records.
meanings.sent3: The vinylic costume made him feel like a rock star.
meanings.sent4: Her vinylic hair shone under the stage lights.
meanings.sent5: The vinylic shine of the floor reflected the neon lights beautifully.
